response.answer_text: Here are cases where lotta “effort” goes on but 0 work gets done. Convincing 50+ yo old people their world-view is dated and soon their opinions won’t matter ( Yep, parents any one? )Convincing the girl you like that she should date you ( yep, yep, I realize V day is coming )Doing Jumping Jack — lotta effort but … meh. No work.Pushing Mount Everest - trying to move it ( equivalent to 1,2,… )Oh you meant the physics one? That is also true for [3,4,…]. Fact.  Thus… any force that could not move any particle where it is being applied… is doing zero work. Now convince yourself.

zero work; if the component of a force is perpendicular to the displacement,zero work is done. E.g, a boy pushing a wall, a man carrying a load and walking on level ground does no work. Negativwork; if the component of a force is in opposite direction to displacement, thework done is negative!
